7.heading: Hahn, Don.
7.title: Atlantis, the Lost Empire [videorecording]
7.author: Walt Disney Pictures ; producer, Don Hahn ; screenplay, Tab Murphy ; directors, Gary Trousdale, Kirk Wise.

publication info.publisher: Distributed by Buena Vista Home Entertainment

notes: 1 videodisc (96 min.) : sd., col. ; 4 3/4 in.
DVD.
Closed-captioned.
Summary (from OCLC): Hidden deep below the ocean surface is one of the greatest mysteries of all time

the Lost City of Atlantis. Join the world's most highly qualified crew of experts led by "adventure capitalist" Commander Rourke and Milo Thatch, a linguist who knows the ancient Atlantean language, as they board the incredible 1,000-foot submarine, the Ulysses, and head deep into the mysteries of the sea, hoping to reveal the secrets of Atlantis.

8.heading: Hahn, Don.
8.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame [videorecording]
8.author: Walt Disney Pictures ; produced by Don Hahn ; animation story by Tab Murphy ; animation screenplay by Tab Murphy, et al
8.appears_in: ; directed by Gary Trousdale and Kirk Wise.
notes: 1 videodisc (91 min.) : sd., col. ; 4 3/4 in.
DVD.
In English with optional soundtrack in French or Spanish; closed-captioned in English.

Summary (from OCLC): Quasimodo ventures from his tower to the joyous festival of fools, but the crowd turns cruel and rejects him because of the way he looks. The gypsy Esmeralda rescues him and he finds himself battling to save the people and the city he loves
while reminding us to see people as they are rather than how they appear.

9.heading: Hahn, Don.
9.title: The Lion King [videorecording]
9.author: Walt Disney Pictures ; produced by Don Hahn ; screenplay by Irene Mecchi and Jonathan Roberts and Linda Woolverton ; directed by Roger Allers and Rob Minkoff.

publication info.publisher: Walt Disney Home Entertainment : Buena Vista Home Entertainment

notes: 2 videodiscs (ca. 90 min.) : sd., col. ; 4 3/4 in.
DVD.
English or French dialogue; closed-captioned.
Originally released as a motion picture in 1994.

Summary (from OCLC): Simba begins life as an honored prince, son of the powerful King Mufasa. The cub's happy childhood turns tragic when his evil uncle Scar murders Mufasa and drives Simba away from the kingdom. In exile, the young lion befriends the comically bumbling pair of Pumbaa the warthog and Timon the meerkat and lives a carefree jungle life. As he approaches adulthood, however, he is visited by the spirit of his father, who instructs him to defeat the nefarious Scar and reclaim his rightful throne.

52.title: "Hail Darkness!"
52.author: by Alexandro Jodorowsky ; illustrated by Moebius
52.series: The Incal Light : The Further Adventures of John Difool
52.appears_in: p. 17-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 11 (Feb. 1982).
notes: "When last we read, there was a revolution in the buried city. John Difool had no idea that the killer meta baron had been thrown onto his heels by Amok, that infamous corporation of killers and ne'eer-do-wells. While trying to escape through the technos citadel, he found himself a prisoner of the techno-pope. Needless to say, his fine-feathered sidekick, Deepo, is in no better position."
"To be continued."

116.heading: Hair.
116.title: "Ganga : the Divine Beauty"
116.author: script, Lakshmi Seshadri ; artwork, S
116.appears_in: S. Havaldar. 30 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 515 (1975, 1998 printing).
notes: (Epics & Mythology)

Summary from back cover: "Ganga's cleansing waters were urgently needed on Earth. But, the dauntless daughter of the mountain god was not to be easily subdued as her waters darted about uncontrollably. Only Shiva could tame her by entangling her in the coils of his hair. When her waters could finally wriggle their way out, they were calmer and purer. They turned arid wastes alive and filled up the oceans. Since those ancient times when King Bhagiratha sought her help, Ganga, whether roaring or placid, dancing or sombre, continues to enchant one and all with her incomparable beauty."
Subtitle, series and summary from 2009 printing.

191.heading: Hair Stylists.
191.title: Beauty Pop
191.author: story and art by Kiyoko Arai ; English adaptation, Amanda Hubbard ; translation, Miho Nishida.
notes: (Shojo Beat Manga)

"Although a truly gifted hairstylist, Kiri Koshiba has no interest in using her talent to pursue fame and fortune, unlike the three popular boys in the "Scissors Project" at school. Determined to become the best makeover team in Japan, they give showy makeovers to handpicked girls. As much as Kiri tries to shy away from the Scissors Project spotlight, she finds herself responding to beauty's call. When Kiri's friend Kanako gives a present to one of the members of the Scissors Project, her act of kindness is interpreted as a bribe to get a makeover, and they reject her for being too ugly. Kiri decides to help Kanako and give the boys a lesson in what true beauty is."
